ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I devolved a solid understanding of elementary Spanish vocabulary and grammar.

I learned how to communicate and comprehend in basic present and past tense Spanish about vacations, family, food, clothing, activities, and shopping. I also learned how to communicate and comprehend weather, events, and time.
I learned the basics of Spanish speaking!

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I think the way the course is taught is a strength itself, however I think canvas assignments should be the only kind of homework. In other words, I don't feel like supersite homework is the best practice. Canvas assignments are better quality practice since it forces us to actively write and the professor can highlight which key points of the topic are worth practicing. I think learning through videos is helpful form supersite but other than that, I am not a fan.
Online assignments were a bit boring.
Good content. Relevant for the level I am at

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! Spanish 110 is fun! Most people know some words and phrases and spanish, and there are a lot of cognates. We get a lot opportunities to be creative with projects, and use the Spanish language to reflect on our lives and share who we are with other people. Plus compared to a level 1 high school spanish class, you walk a way with a really strong command of understanding basic spanish.
